topic.title: IPv6: Set-Up Procedures
topic.shortdesc: Couchbase Server supports IP version 6 (IPv6). Set-up is required for each platform.

section.title: IP Version 6 Overview
section.p: Support for IPv6 is provided only by Couchbase Server Enterprise Edition. Set-up is required for each platform, as described in the sections below. Note that while the steps for Linux and MacOS are to be performed after the basic installation procedure is complete; the steps for Windows are integrated into the basic installation procedure itself.
See Couchbase Server Installation Home for all information on server-installation.

section.title: IPv6 Set-Up for Linux
section.p: After the couchbase package (rpm or deb file) has been installed, the couchbase service is started by default. To enable IPv6, proceed as follows:

ol.li: Restart the couchbase service: this starts Couchbase Server in IPv6 mode. To check, point the browser at http://[::1]:8091, which is the IPv6 address and port number on which Couchbase Server should be running.

section.title: IPv6 Set-Up for Windows
section.p: IPv6 set-up requirements are incorporated into the InstallShield wizard itself: during installation of the Couchbase package, a checkbox allows the user to enable IPv6 mode. (Note that after installation, any subsequent mode-change requires reinstallation.)

section.title: IPv6 Set-Up for MacOS
section.p: After installation of the Couchbase package, proceed as follows:

ol.li: Restart the couchbase service: this starts the server in IPv6 mode. To check, point the browser at http://[::1]:8091, which is the IPv6 address and port number on which Couchbase Server should be running.
